title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Census of Population) Order
text_raw: 1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Census of Population) Order
text_norm: 1 order may cited statistic (census population) order

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: 2. (1) In this Order -
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order - 

“census night” means the period of time commencing at 9 p.m. on 3 April 
2022 and ending at 7 a.m. on 4 April 2022; 

“following morning” means the period of time commencing at 7 a.m. on 4 
April 2022 and ending at noon on that day; 

“Regulation” means Regulation (EC) No. 763/2008 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 9 July 20081; 

“residential communal establishment” means a residential communal 
establishment of any kind, excluding private households, and includes - 

(a) 

(b) 

a hospital, 

a residential facility for persons with intellectual or physical 
disabilities, or both, 

(c) 

a nursing home, 

(d) 

a children’s home, 

(e) 

student specific accommodation, 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

a religious community, 

a defence establishment, 

a prison, 

a shelter or refuge, 

a hotel, 

(k) 

a boarding house, 

(l) 

a guest house, 

(m) a bed and breakfast, 

(n) 

a hostel, and 

1 OJ. No. L 218, 13.8.2008, p. 14 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 29th December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [637] 3 

(o) 

a campsite. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in this Order and also used in the 
Regulation has the same meaning in this Order as in the Regulation, except 
where the context otherwise requires.
text_norm: 2 (1) order - census night mean period time commencing 9 p.m 3 april 2022 ending 7 a.m 4 april 2022 following morning mean period time commencing 7 a.m 4 april 2022 ending noon day regulation mean regulation (ec) no 763 2008 european parliament council 9 july 20081 residential communal establishment mean residential communal establishment kind excluding private household includes - (a) (b) hospital residential facility person intellectual physical disability (c) nursing home (d) child home (e) student specific accommodation (f) (g) (h) (i) (j) religious community defence establishment prison shelter refuge hotel (k) boarding house (l) guest house (m) bed breakfast (n) hostel 1 oj no l 218 13.8.2008 p 14 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 29th december 2020 637 3 (o) campsite (2) word expression used order also used regulation meaning order regulation except context otherwise requires

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: 3. A requirement on the householder or any adult member of a private
text_raw:
3. A requirement on the householder or any adult member of a private 
household to provide - 

(a) 

(b) 

in respect of the private household that is occupied by the person 
on census night or the following morning, he or she not having 
been enumerated elsewhere on that night or morning, information 
the general nature of which is specified in paragraph 1 of the 
Schedule, 

in respect of each person who is alive and in the State at midnight 
on Sunday 3 April 2022 and who occupies the private household 
on census night or the following morning, the person or persons 
not having been enumerated elsewhere on that night or morning, 
information the general nature of which is specified in paragraph 
2 of the Schedule, 

(c) 

information as to whether any or all members of the private 
household are temporarily absent from the household on census 
night and the following morning, 

(d) where all members of the private household are temporarily 
absent from the private household on census night and the 
following morning, in respect of each member of the household 
who is so absent, information the general nature of which is 
specified in paragraph 3 of the Schedule, and 

(e) where some but not all members of the private household are 
temporarily absent from the private household on census night 
and the following morning, in respect of each person who is so 
absent, information the general nature of which is specified in 
paragraph 4 of the Schedule, 

is hereby prescribed.
text_norm: 3 requirement householder adult member private household provide - (a) (b) respect private household occupied person census night following morning enumerated elsewhere night morning information general nature specified paragraph 1 schedule respect person alive state midnight sunday 3 april 2022 occupies private household census night following morning person person enumerated elsewhere night morning information general nature specified paragraph 2 schedule (c) information whether member private household temporarily absent household census night following morning (d) member private household temporarily absent private household census night following morning respect member household absent information general nature specified paragraph 3 schedule (e) member private household temporarily absent private household census night following morning respect person absent information general nature specified paragraph 4 schedule hereby prescribed

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: 4. A requirement on -
text_raw:
4. A requirement on - 

(a) 

(b) 

the manager or other person in charge of a residential communal 
establishment, and 

the master or other person in charge of a vessel (other than a 
vessel comprising a private household) in any harbour, port, bay, 
creek, lake, river, canal or elsewhere in waters within the 
jurisdiction of the State, 

to provide, in respect of the residential communal establishment or vessel, as 
the case may be, information the general nature of which is specified in 
paragraph 5 of the Schedule, is hereby prescribed. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [637]
text_norm: 4 requirement - (a) (b) manager person charge residential communal establishment master person charge vessel (other vessel comprising private household) harbour port bay creek lake river canal elsewhere water within jurisdiction state provide respect residential communal establishment vessel case may information general nature specified paragraph 5 schedule hereby prescribed 4 637

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: 5. A requirement on a person in respect of whom the information specified
text_raw:
5. A requirement on a person in respect of whom the information specified 
in paragraph 2 of the Schedule - 

(a) 

(b) 

is not required by this Order to be provided by another person, or 

is not likely to be provided by another person, 

to provide, in respect of himself or herself, information the general nature of 
which is specified in paragraph 2 of the Schedule, is hereby prescribed. 

 
 
 
 
 [637] 5
text_norm: 5 requirement person respect information specified paragraph 2 schedule - (a) (b) required order provided another person likely provided another person provide respect information general nature specified paragraph 2 schedule hereby prescribed 637 5

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: General nature of information to be provided for purposes of Census of
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

General nature of information to be provided for purposes of Census of 

Population to be conducted in year 2022 

Information regarding the following housing characteristics and facilities

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: Information regarding the following, as it relates to each person to whom
text_raw:
2. 
Information regarding the following, as it relates to each person to whom 
Article 3(b) or 5, as the case may be, applies on census night or the following 
morning: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

first name and surname; 

sex; 

date of birth; 

in the case of a person who occupies a private household, 
relationship to each other person who occupies the household on 
census night or the following morning; 

(e) 

in the case of a person who has attained the age of 15 years, 
marital status; 

(f) 

place of birth; 

(g) usual residence; 

 
 
 
 
 6 [637] 

(h) usual residence on 3 April 2021; 

(i) whether the person has lived outside the State for a continuous 

period of a year or more and, if so - 

(i) 

country of last previous usual residence, and 

(ii) year of last taking up residence in the State; 

(j) 

country of citizenship; 

(k) 

ethnic group or ethnic background; 

(l) 

religion; 

(m) 

in the case of a person who has attained the age of 3 years, ability 
to speak the Irish language and, if so able, frequency of speaking 
and level of Irish and, where Irish is spoken daily, whether it is so 
spoken within or outside the education system; 

(n) whether a language other than English or Irish is spoken by the 
person at home and, where it is, the language concerned and the 
person’s ability to speak English; 

(o) health, including any long-lasting conditions or difficulties and 
the extent and effect of any such conditions and difficulties; 

(p) whether tobacco products are used and, if so, the frequency of 

such use; 

(q) usual means of travel for the journey from home to work, school, 

college or childcare; 

(r) 

(s) 

(t) 

usual time of leaving home for work, school, college or childcare; 

time taken for the journey referred to in subparagraph (q); 

usual time of leaving work, school, college or childcare to return 
home; 

(u) whether the person provides regular, unpaid personal help or 
support to another person and, where so provided, the number of 
hours so provided per week; 

(v) whether the person regularly engages in unpaid help or voluntary 
work in a social or charitable organisation, a religious or church 
group, a sporting organisation, a political organisation or his or 
her community; 

(w) 

in the case of a person who has attained the age of 15 years - 

(i) whether his or her full-time education has ceased and, 

where it has, the age at which it ceased, 

(ii) 

the highest level of education and training completed, and 

(iii) present principal economic status; 

 
 
 
 [637] 7 

(x) 

in the case of a person who has attained the age of 15 years who 
is employed - 

(i) 

employment status, 

(ii) occupation and, where the occupation is that of farmer, the 

size of the area farmed, 

(iii) business of employer or in the case of a person who is self-

employed, his or her own business, 

(iv) name and address of place of work, and 

(v) whether the person ever works from home and, if so, the 

number of days so worked per week; 

(y) 

in the case of a person who has attained the age of 15 years who 
is unemployed - 

(i) 

previous employment status, 

(ii) previous occupation and, where the previous occupation 
was that of farmer, the size of the area previously farmed, 
and 

(iii) previous employer’s business or in the case of a person who 

was self-employed, his or her own business; 

(z) 

in the case of a person who has attained the age of 15 years who 
is retired - 

(i) 

previous employment status, and 

(ii) previous occupation and, where the previous occupation 
was that of farmer, the size of the area previously farmed; 

(aa) in the case of a person attending school or college, name and 

address of school or college, as the case may be; 

(bb) in the case of a person who has not attained the age of 15 years, 

whether the person is in childcare, and if so- 

(i) 

name and address of childcare provider, 

(ii) 

type of childcare, and 

(iii) number of hours spent in childcare per week during term-

times. 

Information regarding the following, as it relates to each person to whom

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: Article 3(d) applies on census night or the following morning:
text_raw:
3. 
Article 3(d) applies on census night or the following morning: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

first name and surname; 

sex; 

date of birth and age; 

(d) 

country of citizenship; 

(e) 

in the case of a member of the household who was not in the State, 
the country where he or she resided; 

 
 
 8 [637] 

(f) 

in the case of a member of the household who was in the 
State, the address at which he or she resided. 

Information regarding the following, as it relates to each person to whom

title: to (h) and 5 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of giving full
heading: communal establishment or vessel, as the case may be, referred to in Article
text_raw:
5. 
communal establishment or vessel, as the case may be, referred to in Article 
4, on census night or the following morning: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

type of residential communal establishment or vessel, as the case 
may be; 

first name and surname of the persons who are alive and in the 
State at midnight on Sunday 3 April 2022 and occupy the 
establishment or vessel, as the case may be; 

confirmation in respect of each person referred to in subparagraph 
(b) as to whether an individual form was issued to and collected 
from the person by the manager or other person in charge of the 
establishment or by the master or other person in charge of the 
vessel, as the case may be. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 December, 2020. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach.
